markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Gems and Art Objects](/Rules.aspx?ID=1110)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 114</row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Many people treasure gems for their brilliant colors and for the alchemical or even magical properties some have. Works of art and their value, meanwhile, vary as widely as the concept of beauty between cultures. They may be more elegant versions of useful items, or exist solely to be admired and envied.

 Much like coins, gems and art objects are valuable currency worth their full Price when sold. When making a treasure hoard, you can choose gems or art objects you like, or roll randomly using percentile dice.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<document level="2" id="rules-1111" />

<document level="2" id="rules-1112" />

text: Gems and Art Objects Source Gamemastery Guide pg. 114 Many people treasure gems for their brilliant colors and for the alchemical or even magical properties some have. Works of art and their value, meanwhile, vary as widely as the concept of beauty between cultures. They may be more elegant versions of useful items, or exist solely to be admired and envied. Much like coins, gems and art objects are valuable currency worth their full Price when sold. When making a treasure hoard, you can choose gems or art objects you like, or roll randomly using percentile dice.
